primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus as the Door provides access to God, safety in suffering, and spiritual nourishment for all people regardless of their past.

tekstueel_bewijs: I am come that they might have life
Christ then for us is the door to God
He prepares a table before me

object.identificatie: Access to God / Life / Safety (Safe and Sound)
tekstueel_bewijs: the opening, the passageway, the entranceway to life
he will be safe and sound

zender.identificatie: The Great 'I AM' (God the Father/Divine Authority)
tekstueel_bewijs: God said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM
Christ then is the New Testament 'I AM'
the sinner is invited to enter; the thief may come
It is my invitation signed by Jesus

helper.identificatie: The Shepherd's Body / The Blood of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: the shepherd would lie across the opening
reservation ticket with the blood marks of Jesus upon it
danger of wild animals and sheep thieves
lurking foes, grim rocks, fierce heat
the door was closed to me
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is characterized as both the internal state of the sinner (thief, drunkard) and the external 'perilous journey' of life/death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The rhythm of the Christian life: going 'in' for strength and 'out' to serve the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Service to the world / Guidance for others
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher explicitly states we must go 'in' (Primary Program) before we go 'out' (Secondary Program).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Great I AM → Life/Safety → Any Man

voorbeelden_god_subject: He prepares a table before me
The Lord shall preserve thy going out
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we may go out to serve

voorbeelden: we must first get that strength
if he desires to enter there
All that one needs is a desire
learn to comprehend... what is the breadth

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) granted by Christ. The hearer is incompetent to enter God's presence, but Christ as the Door provides the capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Closed Door' of human experience (Adelaide) to the 'Open Door' of Christ's invitation.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension of being an 'outsider' is resolved by the 'Any Man' invitation of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon uses the imagery of being trampled in a fire to illustrate the gravity of missing the door.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains Christ as the Subject of the primary action. Human participation is reduced to the simple act of 'entering' (receiving), while all provision and protection are divine acts.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: All that one needs is a desire, a will, to enter there.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He prepares a table before me in the presence of my enemies.
The adulterer is not shut out; the murderer may go in.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples to follow, but as recipients of God's action.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Moses is used to establish the identity of God, not as a hero to emulate.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic emphasis on salvation; the believer is the beneficiary of Christ's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (salvation) to the secondary (service) is perfectly ordered.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the shepherd would lie across the opening... no enemy could get in or out without crossing the stretched-out body

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit leads into truth and provides the 'energy and power' to go out.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; includes specific mentions of 'murderer' and 'thief' to show the reach of grace.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented narrative structure where Christ is the Subject and the hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The slight emphasis on 'will' (Vouloir) is appropriate for an invitation.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as 'lurking foes' and 'grim rocks'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully uses the 'I AM' metaphor to ground the hearer's identity in Christ's objective work rather than subjective performance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the Adelaide anecdote's pathos, Greimasian analysis shows that anecdote functions as a 'lack' (Opponent) that only the Subject (Christ) can fill.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the shepherd's door; semiotics explains why the shepherd *must* be the Subject for the sermon to remain 'Gospel'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Any Man' invitation is not a human work but a 'Receiver' status granted by the 'Sender' (The Great I AM).

volledige_subject_lijst: We (enter, go in, go out, serve)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If you... then God' trap by framing the 'If' as an entrance into a pre-existing reality (the fold).
